channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Counseling Center Announces Support Group for International Graduate Students
item.description: The Counseling Center invites International Graduate students to participate in a new drop-in therapeutic support group. Bi-weekly sessions begin on September 8th, 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. at the ISSS office. These meetings are free and confidential and offer the opportunity to connect with others, share common struggles, and learn skills for success.
item.author: Students

item.title: CCPD & M/E Engineering Info Session | Oct. 7
item.description: M/E Engineering will be hosting an info session on-campus on Tuesday, October 7th from 5:30-7:30pm to discuss their available and upcoming opportunities, including positions for December graduates. Join the CCPD in learning more about the company and network with recruiters! Register and learn more in Handshake.
item.author: Students

item.title: Your Final Semester - Now What: Immigration | Oct. 6
item.description: Date: Monday, October 6, 2025 2:00 PM - 3:00 PM - Join ISSS for a virtual workshop to learn about the immigration options for life after graduation. Topics include employment, continuing your studies, departing the U.S., and more.
item.author: Students

item.title: Study Tricks & Treats That Actually Work | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - This hands-on session covers executive functioning, note-taking strategies, memory techniques, and assistive tech demos. Optional 1-on-1 coaching sign-ups available. Register here: https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=4VP2qs0LLEyGWBLrA-FXdNtLro-Zf1RHtKeMXgtgmKRUNEs0SFE3OFJGNlExVEY2V1o5OE01NloxSy4u
item.author: Students

item.title: Get ahead in Business- FREE PIZZA + INFO SESSION | Oct. 8
item.description: Find out how to start your MBA or M.S. at Lally while finishing your undergraduate degree. Wednesday, Oct. 8. 12-1 PM Pitts 5216. Learn how RPI’s Co-Terminal & Accelerated Master’s Programs let you earn your master’s sooner, strengthen your resume, and open doors for your career. We’ll cover program options, admissions steps, and how to make these pathways work for your goals. Pizza provided!
item.author: Students

item.title: Students - We Need Your Feedback
item.description: Shape the future of RPI’s campus by completing our campus-wide master planning survey. We want to hear directly from you about how you use RPI’s spaces today and what you’d like to see in the future. Your perspective will help us create a campus that better supports learning, research, and the overall student experience. Take the survey. The survey will remain open through October 12 and takes 15-20 minutes to complete. More opportunities to share your perspective are coming, including open…
item.author: Students

item.title: MSE Seminar: Dr. Eric Brown | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Los Alamos Neutron Science Center (LANSCE) and Semi-crystalline Polymers Dr. Eric Brown Director of the Los Alamos Neutron Science Center (LANSCE) and Senior Director in the Associate Laboratory Directorate for Physical Sciences at Los Alamos National Laboratory
item.author: Community

item.title: Reunion & Homecoming | Oct. 10
item.description: Date: Friday, October 10, 2025 12:00 AM - Mon , October 13, 2025 12:00 AM - The campus community is invited to join alumni and their guests as we celebrate RPI! Attendees will be attending sporting events, enjoying social gatherings, taking tours, and learning about RPI’s academic offerings, groundbreaking research, and campus innovations. Visit the website for a full schedule of events.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2025 Annual Electrical & Steam Shutdowns
item.description: 2025 Annual Shutdowns The Annual Utility Shutdown for Assessment and Repair will occur Saturday, May 10th through Saturday May 17th, 2025. The central steam plant will be shut down and there will be selective power outages throughout the campus. Please review the Steam Shutdown and Electrical Outages spreadsheets for your building. Contact Ms. Lynn Gray, grayl4@rpi.edu with questions or concerns about the utility interruptions. This work is done on the main…
item.author: Community

item.title: Free Flu Shots for Students
item.description: The Student Health Center will be hosting flu shot clinics across campus the week of 10/6: Monday in DCC; Tuesday in the Union; Wednesday in ECAV. Don’t miss this opportunity to protect yourself from seasonal influenza. Cost: no charge! Benefit: no missed classes due to the flu!
item.author: Community

item.title: Department of Chemistry Fall 2025 Seminar Series
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 7, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - As part of this week’s Chemistry Seminar Series, Folsom Librarians Stacey Amundson and Brenden McCarthy will speak on “LIBRARIES at RPI: A Discussion on Library Resources for Researchers”. Come learn about the many resources available to researchers on campus.
item.author: Community

item.title: October Dining Events!
item.description: We’ve got an exciting month of dining events planned—mark your calendars and join us for great food, fun, and festivities at our dining halls and retail locations across campus!
item.author: Community

item.title: CEE Fall Seminar Series - Dr. Jorge A. Rivero Asst. Professor in Economics at RPI | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - “Latent Type Heterogeneity in Dynamic Empirical Models”. This talk introduces the semiparametric type fixed effects (TFE) linear panel model that allows for heterogeneous coefficients and time-varying patterns of heterogeneity, driven by a latent, time-invariant continuous random variable referred to as a “type”. Further details presented at the seminar.
item.author: Community

item.title: EHS Shares Safety Tips for Fire Prevention Week
item.description: The National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) 2025 Fire Prevention Week theme is “Charge into Fire Safety: Lithium-Ion Batteries in Your Home.” In support of this year’s campaign, EHS has gathered key safety tips on reducing fire hazards connected to everyday rechargeable devices and battery-powered equipment.
item.author: Community

item.title: Physics, Applied Physics and Astronomy Colloquium: Professor Jun Xiao, University of Wisconsin, Madison | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Title: “Strong Terahertz electrodynamics in emergent 2D materials”
item.author: Community

item.title: CBE Abbott Lecture - Dr. Randall Snurr | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 9:15 AM - 11:15 AM - The Michael M. Abbott Lecture Series hosted each fall in the Chemical Engineering Department honors Abbott’s legacy and celebrates his achievements. This year’s speaker is Dr. Randall Snurr, Professor from Northwestern University. Dr. Snurr’s seminar titled “Abbott Lecture: Adsorption Hysteresis and Effects of Framework Flexibility in Nanoporous Materials: Thermodynamics and Applications” is opened to all. Refreshments will be available in…
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Topical Seminar: “Spectrum sharing and dynamic spectrum assignment with spectrum consumption models: Current status and perspectives” | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join us for an ECSE Topical Seminar: “Spectrum sharing and dynamic spectrum assignment with spectrum consumption models: Current status and perspectives” with Prof. Carlos Enrique Caicedo of Syracuse University. Abstract and speaker bio can be found at the event URL.
item.author: Community

item.title: 1st Meeting of the LGBTQ+ Task Force for 2025-2026! | Oct. 9
item.description: Join us for the first meeting of the LGBTQ+ Task Force for the 2025-2026 academic year! We are meeting on Thursday, October 9 at 4PM in the J-Rowl Science Center 1C13. Please join us if you are interested in supporting and connecting with RPI’s LGBTQ+ Community! Please email lgbtqtaskforce@rpi.edu with any questions.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty Spotlight on Research & Impact webinar series-Ed Palermo | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 2:00 PM - 2:30 PM - Do you know how RPI Engineering faculty are shaping the future? In just 20 minutes, you’ll discover how their research is changing the world! Join us to learn how TED Talk meets research presented in PechaKucha style! Open to ALL!! Can the brain and spine truly heal themselves after injury? Dr. Ed Palermo will show you how he makes “Science that Heals”.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2025 RPI Graduate School Expo | Oct. 23
item.description: Register for the CCPD’s Graduate School Expo! On Thursday, October 23rd, all students are welcome to interact with graduate schools and learn about their programs. This event will be from 1-4pm in Sage Banquet Hall. Whether you’re actively applying to grad schools, just beginning to consider it, or aren’t sure if it’s the decision you’ll make, this is a great opportunity to meet with graduate school representatives (including RPI!). Learn more, register, and view attending schools in Handshake!
item.author: Community

item.title: TIAA Confidential Counseling (In-Person) | Oct. 6
item.description: Date: Monday, October 6, 2025 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM - A TIAA Financial Consultant will be available for one-on-one consultations on a broad range of retirement topics. Attend this upcoming event to help you become better informed and more confident about Rensselaer’s retirement plan benefits. Consultations will be conducted in 60 minute increments. To schedule, please call TIAA at 1-800-732-8353 or online at https://shared.tiaa.org/public/publictools/events/meetingatworkplace
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar – “Assigning Learning in Percipio: A Guide for Supervisors” | Oct. 8
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - This course provides supervisors with a step-by-step overview of how to assign learning content to employees using Percipio. You’ll learn how to search for relevant courses, create and manage assignments, track completion, and support your team’s development goals. Designed to be quick and practical, this session equips you with the tools needed to guide your team’s learning journey effectively.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Rensselaer Faculty and Staff Webinar: Active Learning Examples to Keep Your Students Engaged | Oct. 8
item.description: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:00 PM - If you are interested in hearing more about various active learning exercises that you may be able to implement into your course, then this workshop is for you. Please join me to discuss the practice of active learning, the benefits, and some of the more popular active learning exercises. Maureen Fodera (Office of Undergraduate Education) will be presenting this webinar. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Faculty & Staff - We Need Your Feedback
item.description:
As part of our campus master planning process, we invite you to complete a campus-wide survey to help shape a future that meets the needs of the RPI community. The survey is designed to capture how faculty and staff use the Troy campus today and how spaces can better support learning, research, and campus life in the future. Your feedback will provide essential insight as we develop plans for classroom renewal, research spaces, offices, and more.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
